title: Rs 5,636 million allocated for Defence Division
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 12 (APP): The Federal Government has earmarked an amount of Rs 5,636 million for the Defence Division under the Public Sector Development Programme (PSDP) 2024-25,.
According to a budgetary document released on Wednesday, a total Rs 4,506.33 million is allocated for the ongoing and Rs 1,129.667 million for the new schemes of the Defence Division.
The Defence Division’s NIHD Center of Excellence for Preventive , Cardiovascular Research & Development (NEPCARD) gets the highest allocation of Rs 1.185 billion.
Similarly, Development of ICT and Artificial Intelligence Based Precision Agriculture System utilizing dual-use Aerospace Technologies – GreenAI gets Rs732.857 million, Establishment of National Aerospace Science & Technology Park (NASTP) Aviation City Pakistan (ACP) Rs 864.689 million, Establishment of National University of Pakistan, Islamabad Rs 77.476 million, Acquisition of Land from CDA for Establishing Medical City at Islamabad by National University of Medical Science (Phase-I) Rs 623.899 million, Water Distribution Network for RCB/CCB based on Khanpur Dam Water Source (Phase-III) Rs 2 million, Establishment of New Generation National Geodetic Datum of Pakistan Rs 321 million, Construction of two Fast Response Boats (FRBs) for PMSA Rs 420 million, and Establishment Technology Assessment Lab project Rs 279.895 million allocation.
The new scheme of Establishment of FG Junior Public School Gwadar get Rs 184.667 million, Establishment of FG Junior Public School Gilgit Rs195 million, and Unmanned Aerial Vehicles System for Law Enforcement, Emergency Search & Rescue and Pollution Control Mission Rs 400 million.
